To calculate the standard deviation of the combined measurements for the amount of liquid and the amount of alcohol in the liquid, you can use the following steps:

1. Calculate the mean of the sample measurements for the amount of liquid:
Mean liquid = (95+97+101+102+104)/5 = 99.8 grams
2. Calculate the mean of the sample measurements for the amount of alcohol:
Mean alcohol = (26+28+31+33)/4 = 29 grams
3. Calculate the deviation of each measurement for the amount of liquid from the mean:
Deviation of 95 = 95 - 99.8 = -4.8
Deviation of 97 = 97 - 99.8 = -2.8
Deviation of 101 = 101 - 99.8 = 1.2
Deviation of 102 = 102 - 99.8 = 2.2
Deviation of 104 = 104 - 99.8 = 4.2
4. Calculate the deviation of each measurement for the amount of alcohol from the mean:
Deviation of 26 = 26 - 29 = -3
Deviation of 28 = 28 - 29 = -1
Deviation of 31 = 31 - 29 = 2
Deviation of 33 = 33 - 29 = 4
5. Calculate the variance of the combined measurements using the formula for the variance of a sum of two random variables:
Variance = Variance of liquid + Variance of alcohol + 2 x Covariance of liquid and alcohol

where
Variance of liquid = variance of the sample measurements for the amount of liquid = 10^2 = 100
Variance of alcohol = variance of the sample measurements for the amount of alcohol = 4.4^2 = 19.36
Covariance of liquid and alcohol = [(95-99.8)x(26-29) + (97-99.8)x(28-29) + (101-99.8)x(31-29) + (102-99.8)x(33-29) + (104-99.8)x(33-29)]/(5-1)
= [(-4.8)x(-3) + (-2.8)x(-1) + (1.2)x2 + (2.2)x4 + (4.2)x4]/4
= 19.75

Variance = 100 + 19.36 + 2 x 19.75 = 159.86 grams^2
6. Calculate the standard deviation of the combined measurements by taking the square root of the variance:
Standard deviation = sqrt(159.86) = 12.65 grams

Therefore, the standard deviation of the combined measurements for the amount of liquid and the amount of alcohol in the liquid is 12.65 grams. This means that the actual amount of liquid and alcohol in the liquid is expected to vary from their respective means by approximately plus or minus 12.65 grams.
